summary: "Detective Pikachu" Predicted to open at over $50 million
title: "Detective Pikachu" Predicted to open at over $50 million
body:
“Detective Pikachu” Predicted to open at over $50 million domestically.

This weekend, Detective Pikachu, the first live action film from the Pokemon franchise, is opening to a wide release, and pre-release forecasting indicates that this film will blow previous titles out of the water. So let’s take some time to compare this film to some of its predecessors.

(more…)

summary: Detective Pikachu Event on Pokémon GO beings later today
title: Detective Pikachu Event on Pokémon GO beings later today
body:
Uncover mysteries in Pokémon GO with POKÉMON Detective Pikachu!

Trainers,

Get your detective hats ready and start looking for clues as we celebrate the one and only POKÉMON Detective Pikachu movie! Do you have what it takes to keep up with the famous caffeine-powered detective who’s about to electrify audiences all over the world?

Date + Time

Tuesday, May 7, 2019, at 1 p.m. to Friday, May 17, 2019, at 1 p.m. PDT (GMT −7)

Features:

- Select Pokémon featured in the movie will appear in raids.

- Pokémon that appear in the movie will show up more frequently in the wild.

- If you’re lucky, you could be photobombed by a Pikachu in a detective hat—with a chance to catch one of your very own!

Bonus: 

- Double XP for catching Pokémon

- Field Research

- Specially themed Field Research will be available for a limited time during this event.

Detective Pikachu Themed avatar items will be available in the Style Shop





Don’t miss out on the limited-time celebration of the new movie POKÉMON Detective Pikachu!

—The Pokémon GO Team

Source: https://pokemongolive.com/post/pikapika2019

summary: Pokémon: Detective Pikachu Is a Decent Adventure with a Messy Mix of Styles
title: Pokémon: Detective Pikachu Is a Decent Adventure with a Messy Mix of Styles
body:
Detective Pikachu is at its best as a neo-noir sendup, but that genre doesn’t stick around for the whole movie.

Adults might be forgiven for wondering how much of a kid’s movie Pokémon: Detective Pikachu would really be. The trailers show a detective neo-noir style, complete with dark lighting and a shady scheme involving conspiracies and murder. But though the film certainly slaps on the Blade Runner–esque atmosphere and a serious suit of intrigue, rest assured that it’s too ridiculously cute with its…

View On WordPress

summary: Detective Pikachu Director Reacts to Sonic The Hedgehog Backlash, Redesign
title: Detective Pikachu Director Reacts to Sonic The Hedgehog Backlash, Redesign
excerpt: Detective Pikachu director Rob Letterman weighs in on the live-action Sonic the Hedgehog movie changing the title character's design.
description:
“There’s no right or wrong to how you make one of these movies,“ he told The Verge. "It would be very difficult for us to redesign anything. We spent a year designing all the characters ahead of shooting so that we could get it all right. If we were off by an inch on Pikachu, [actor] Justice Smith’s performance would go right out the window. For us, it would have been impossible – but that doesn’t mean they can’t do it. I wouldn’t want to be in their shoes — they’re in a difficult spot.”

“We studied a lot of animals and how they behave and how they interact to ensure we got it right,” he said. “Bulldogs, in particular, for Bulbasaur and how they act in packs or how they get you to pay attention. There’s an extraordinary amount of craft that went into making the movie on the animation side as we tried to bring everything to life.”

I feel like Rob Letterman’s commentary is both respectful, as in the fact he is not insulting his fellow film makers, and important because it underlines one thing clearly: respect for the franchise. The DT team worked with the Pokemon Company to make sure things remained true to the original design while also bringing in how they would work on a realistic setting. On the other hand Sonic’s original creators have apologized and stated that they were never contacted prior to the film being made 

there is a sense of disrespect as the film makers never contacted the original Sonic team as if to say “we can do better than them” even though their original design has worked since 1991, and then the team thanked the fans for forcing them to change that design. So a part of me wants to appreciate that they are willing to do better but honestly, they are just doing now what they should have done in the first place since 2017 or earlier, and that is sad because it shows how little they cared until it looked like they would loose money on the project. 

this whole situation should be used on film classes as examples of what to do and what not to do when adapting a property. Although that might not matter since Hollywood has been doing that shit since the Mario Bros movie and never got better until now…
